    \index{script-iReportMaker2 \textit{(script)}|(}
\section{Script script-iReportMaker2}

    \label{script-iReportMaker2}
Make a PDF report from the log file generated by the VarCall workflow.


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%                               Functions                               %%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

    \label{script-iReportMaker2:extractReadStatistics}
    \index{script-iReportMaker2 \textit{(script)}!script-iReportMaker2.extractReadStatistics \textit{(function)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{extractReadStatistics}(\textit{lines})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Extract reads statistics from the log file lines.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
      \textbf{Parameters}
      \vspace{-1ex}

      \begin{quote}
        \begin{Ventry}{xxxxx}

          \item[lines]

          lines of the log file

            {\it (type=list)}

        \end{Ventry}

      \end{quote}

      \textbf{Return Value}
    \vspace{-1ex}

      \begin{quote}
      dictionnary with sample name in key and for value an other     
      dictionnary with the number of reads before and after trimming,
      the number of reads mapped and properly paired,         and the deep 
      and breadth coverage.

      {\it (type=dictionnary)}

      \end{quote}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \raggedright \textbf{version}()

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Find all version of all tools used by VarCall

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
      \textbf{Return Value}
    \vspace{-1ex}

      \begin{quote}

      {\it (type=dictionnary)}

      \end{quote}

    \end{boxedminipage}
